item.title: "Are you a Writer?"
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1240" align="alignright" width="225" caption="John Althouse Cohen on Flickr"][/caption]

“Every human being has hundreds of separate people living under his skin. The talent of a writer is his ability to give them their separate names, identities, personalities and have them relate to other characters living with him.” - Mel Brooks

I was standing on the train platform on my way into New York when a young girl standing with her mother looked over and asked me, "Are you a writer?"

I have never been asked this before. Normally, if people see me carrying my journal, they ask if I write, but not if I am myself a 'writer'. But this girl thought I looked like a writer, with my long hair, unshaven beard, and worn leather jacket. Or maybe it was the classically creative look of my Moleskine journal (thank you Moleskine, I will never make fun of your pretentiousness again).

The question left me speechless for a moment. I was almost suspicious, as if the girl had asked me, "Would you like an extra $500?" The first thing you want is to say yes, but it just seems too easy.
